greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Simple self-inverse permutation of natural numbers: after a(0)=0, list each block of A260734(n) numbers in reverse order, from A260732(n) to A260733(1+n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10028
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
mathematica: f[n_] := NestWhileList[# - (If[First@ # > 0, 1, Length[First@ Split@ #] + 1] &@ SquaresR[Range@ 4, #]) &, n^2, # != 0 &]; t = Table[Table[n, {Length[#] - 1 &@ NestWhileList[# - (If[First@ # > 0, 1, Length[First@ Split@ #] + 1] &@ SquaresR[Range@ 4, #]) &, ((n + 1)^2) - 1, # != (n^2) - 1 &]}], {n, 20}] // Flatten ; {0}~Join~Table[Length@ f@ t[[n]] - 1 + Length@ f[t[[n]] + 1] - n - 2, {n, 81}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 08 2016 *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 07 2016
